intro: Medinilla simplicymosa, commonly known as the velvet tangerine. It is a flowering plant native to the Philippines, characterized by its glossy, waxy leaves and clusters of fragrant, pinkish-white flowers. The plant belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. Medinilla simplicymosa is also valued for its use in traditional medicine.
